name: Aiguilles d'Arves
description:
Color: Aiguilles d'Arves

Description: Red Based Brown with near linear holographic pigment. Please note this polish does contain spectraflair. A non-near liner holographic pigment can be used upon request only. 

Finish: Holographic (near linear)

Collection: Part of the fan collection (Dec 2013)

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Tin Oxide, Iron Oxide, Polyethylene Terephthalate, Aluminum

Color: Le Crêt de la neige

Description: Dusty Coral orange base with an arrangement of gunmetal and silver glitters. Application tip: Please allow drying time between layers. 3 coats for optimal coverage.

Finish: Glitter in a colored creme/Jelly Base

Collection: Part of the fan collection (Dec 2013)

name: Yeti Loves the Holidays
description:
Color: Yeti Loves the Holidays

Description: Clear base with loads of gold micro shimmer, gold flake shimmer, blend of white glitters, including circles, Red circles, Green circles and Gold holographic stars. Application Tip: 1 coat usually gives a desired effect, 2 coats the shimmer can be overwhelming. 

Finish: Heavy glitter, Topper

Collection: Seasonal Release only available for the month of december. (Dec 2013) 

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, glitter

name: 2AM walks with Farrihn
description:
Color: 2AM walks with Farrihn

Description: like a bouquet of street side flowers in a bottle. Blend of various purple, pink, fuchsia & green glitters in a Grey Jelly base. Dries to a high shine. 3 coats for full coverage on its own or pair with your favorite grey and use it as a 1 coat topper.

Finish: Glitter in Lightly Colored Jelly Base

Inspiration: Part of the "Wild Flower" collection. 2AM walks was inspired by a nice, quiet middle of the night walk with a friend (Farrihn) on the streets of NYC. A flower market illuminated by streetlights. One specific bouquet stood out then an inspiration was born. 

Batch Notes & Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Glitter 
Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: Avalanche!
description: Color: Avalanche! Description: 10 different types of holographic glitter. Big and small blended together. large diamond, large hex, medium hex, small hex, Small and Large Circle glitter, holographic microglitters. Finish: Heavy glitter Inspiration: The inspiration for this Heavy Glitter Top Coat is every climbers worst nightmare, but also a force of nature that changes the landscape for years of vegetation and wildlife afterwards. Powerful avalanches can actually capture rocks, trees, and other materials within their mix of snow, ice, and air. I've seen a few avalanches in my lifetime. Two of which were while climbing in B.C. Canada. Thankfully I never saw them really close up and was able to watch from a safe distance. I'm in awe of the power and beauty. Batch Differences: Slightly less diamonds Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, glitter Stainless Steal Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

description:
*thanks to Idanailsit for the beautiful swatch picture* Bottle shots turned out dustier and more red than it actually is... Ida's shots are more accurate*

Color: Ave Secretan

Description: A beautiful Punch Pink/Red crème with an incredibly high shine finish

Finish: Creme, has a thin liquid consistency 

Inspiration:  Part of the Buttes-Chaumont collection invites you (via color story) to take a quiet romantic stroll through my favorite park in all of Paris. Buttes-Chaumont. The elevations this month are of the street level variety. Yet, still has all of the brilliant color inspiration that some of the highest elevations can provide. 

Batch Differences: None

name: Black Ice
description:
Color: Black Ice

Description: Dark Charcoal with loads of silver and white shimmer and hints of multi colored shimmer with a matte finish.

Finish: Matte/Shimmer

Inspiration: Part of the "Naughty By Nature" Collection. Inspired by the nasty black ice that always seems to be on the road in the winter time in Minnesota. 

Batch Notes & Differences: None

Ingredients: Water (Aqua), Styrene/Acrylates/Ammonium Methacrylate copolymor, Dipropylene glycol dibenzoate, Propylene glycol n-butyl ether, Ammonium acrylates copolymer, Sodium Magnesium Silicate, Tetrasodium pyrophosphate and may contain: Black Iron Oxide, Titanium Dioxide, Tin Oxide, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Mica, Aluminum Calcium Sodium Silicate

name: Colline du Charf
description:
Color: Colline du Charf Description: Taupe heavily tinted with lilac/purple Finish: Creme Inspiration: Part of the Morocco Collection. Colline du Charf is not really a mountain but more of a hill. It's got this view that could challenge mountains though. Coastline from Cap Malabata in the east to La Montagne in the west. The color ispiration was taken from the hill itself and not the view. It's dusty, it's taupe like but at dusk it has the faintest hint of purple. Batch Differences: None Ingredients:butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxide Nail Polish Grade, Stainless Steel mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames. Swatch Photos Courtesy of: XOXO Alexis Leigh
Ida Nails it
Spaz & Squee

name: Dark Cloud (Traveling Polish)
description:
Color: Dark Cloud (Traveling Polish) 

Description: Clear Base with various sizes and shapes of Periwinkle & Navy glitters. 

Finish: Heavy glitter (Thick)

Inspiration: Dark Cloud is commonly known as the traveling polish. It’s a super fun idea that 3 fantastic ladies gave me. The original idea was a polish that was shared among a small group, used during their wonderful adventurous travels, pictures taken at each of the various vacation sites. Like a roaming gnome. Nothing like sharing a little polish among friends. To make this idea/concept work for everyone. I decided to release a polish that will be available to everyone on my website. No sharing the actual polish, only the pictures.

To read more about the Traveling Polish or to see the dark cloud adventure gallery follow the link:
http://lovebrownnailpolish.wordpress.com/dark-cloud-project/

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Glitter 
Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: Echinops
description: Color: Echinops Description: Soft Lavender/Bluple creme base with medium/low density holographic pigment. Dries to a medium shine. Full coverage in 1-2 coats. Finish: Holographic (low density) Inspiration: Part of "Wildflower Collection" Echinops is a color based off the wild flower by the same name. Batch Differences: None Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxide Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames Swatch Photos Courtesy of: Ida Nails it

name: El Cap II
description:
Pic Details: 2 coats, top coat, pictured in indoor indirect sunlight & outdoor direct sunlight

Color: El Cap II

Description: The base is a bright vivid blue. It’s packed with a lot of Violet micro shimmer. To me this color almost reads like Electric Lilac. It dries to a near matte finish. It isn’t very shiny on it’s own. Adding top coat helps the shimmer pack more punch. It dries very quickly without the help of top coat so if you like the matte like finish it will make for a super quick mani change.

Finish: Near Matte/Shimmer

Inspiration: When you look at pictures of El Capitan. Blue with violet shimmer wouldn’t be most people’s thoughts. It’s slightly unexpected. Watching the movie that inspired the collection (180 degrees south) and going through some of my friends wife’s pictures of her climb of El cap. I noticed something. The sky is always bluer looking from the top and the way the the sun sets on that part of the world is beautiful. It has almost a violet cast to it. I knew I wanted to use that as my color inspiration.

Batch Differences: Starting Sept 7th. New formula. Thicker with just a tad more blue than the original formula. 

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, ferric ammonium ferrocyanide, propane/
bisaminomethylnorbornane copolymer, Iron Oxide
Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: Epidote
description:
Color: Epidote

Description: Olive/Moss green holographic polish. It has 2 sizes of cosmetic grade holographic pigment. This product does not contain “spectraflair” The holographic pigment has a low/medium density. Some of the holo pigment may look just silver in certain lights. 2 coats for full coverage, 3 for longer nails and best results.

Finish: Holographic 

Inspiration: Part of the "Stones Throw Collection" Inspired by the mineral/gem of the same name. 

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxide, Tin Oxide 
Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames

name: Everest
description: Color: Everest Description: Brown with fine holographic shimmer Finish: Holographic Glitter Inspiration: As you know, Everest is the earth's highest mountain, with a peak that stands 29,029 feet above sea level in the Himalaya range. It's not the most technically challenging climb, but because it's the highest, it attracts the most climbers. Whether expert or not, and even being led by professional guides, Everest still poses some of the most dangerous conditions on earth. However, its summit is one of the most magical sights on earth. I never attempted to climb to the top of Everest. Looking mid way up the mountain watching the clouds roll from the base camp is an experience that I feel very lucky to have had. Batch Differences: None Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Tin Oxide, Iron Oxide, Polyethylene Terephthalate, Aluminum Stainless Steal Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: Jbel Ayachi
description:
Color: Jbel Ayachi Description: Silver glitter in multiple sizes & Glacier Mint Colored matte hexes. The glacier mint colored hexes really give this polish more body and make the silver really shine bright. I can almost miss them if you don't look closely. Finish: Heavy glitter (Thick) Inspiration: Part of the Morocco Collection. Jbel Ayachi is one of the highest peaks in north Africa. The color inspiration came to me strangely. I was thinking about how Jbel Ayachi is one of the most amazing jewel of a mountain. I started thinking about the peaks of Jbel Ayachi and how they look white but really they have a reflective glacier blue twinge to them but they glisten like actual jewels and that his how Jbel Ayachi came to be. Batch Differences: None Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Glitter Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. name: Marmolada

name: Matsuda
description:
Color: Matsuda

Description: Darkened Red creme-jelly with hidden on tone shimmer. with one coat it can be used like a jelly and 2 coats for full coverage. It can be used for a jelly sandwich. It can be made even more jelly by using up a bit and adding clear nail polish to it. 

Finish: Creme-Jelly Hybrid with hidden shimmer

Inspiration: Part of the Japan Collection. Mount Matsuda is an interesting mountain. Red wouldn't normally be a color you'd pull as inspiration. I thought red would be the perfect fit for this dormant volcano. The color reflects it's deep past of eruption. 

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Tin Oxide, Silica, Iron Oxide, D&C red 7 (CI 15850)

Some of the holo pigment may look just silver in certain lights. 2 coats for full coverage, 3 for longer nails.

Finish: Holographic shimmer

description:
Color: Naked Night Sky

Description: Taupe jelly base with an arrangement of Blues and aqua glitters including circles. Application tip: Please allow drying time between layers. 3 coats for optimal coverage. 

Finish: Glitter in a colored Jelly Base

Inspiration: Part of the "Naughty By Nature" Collection. Inspired by the evening sky right before all goes dark. It's still light but you can see the stars starting to come out.

name: Pic de Sotllo
description:
Pic details: 2 coats, Seche Vite top coat pictured in outdoors direct sunlight, last two bottom pictures are taken outdoors indirect sunlight. 

Color: Pic de Sotllo

Description: Vibrant Blue creme with no shimmer

Finish: Creme 

Inspiration: The Pyrénées is a mountain range separating Spain from France. Pic de Sotllo Located in this mountain range was an amazing sight. Technically it is on the Spanish side of the Pyrénées. The color was not inspired by the mountain itself but the color you see on a bright summer day at the top. The sky is clean, vibrant, fresh and Blue. You can almost breathe in the Blue.

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Iron Oxide
Stainless Steal Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames

name: Pic de Subenuix
description:
Pic details: 2 coats, Dior top coat pictured in outdoor direct sunlight.

Color: Pic de Subenuix

Description: Blue leaning Purple base tone, blue iridescent shimmer, Packed full of light green micro shimmer

Finish: Iridescent, almost duochrome

Inspiration: The Pyrénées is a mountain range separating Spain from France. Pic de Subenuix Located in this mountain range was an amazing sight. Technically it is on the Spanish side of the Pyrénées but it sounds french. The name refers to the important pontarró by which the road crosses the river Portarró Subenuix.Lush short grasses live on the side of subenuix and in the valley. The rock faces almost look purple from a distance then flash blue. All of these colors combined to create the inspiration for this Polish.

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Tin Oxide, Silica, Iron Oxide
Stainless Steal Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames

name: Pic du Gar
description:
Pic details: 2 coats, no top coat pictured in both indoors indirect sunlight and outdoors direct sunlight

Color: Pic du Gar

Description: Plum purple creme leans a little to the red side of purple. 

Finish: Creme , Jelly Hybrid "Crelly"

Inspiration: The Pyrénées is a mountain range separating Spain from France. Pic du Gar is located on the French side of the Pyrénées. All I remember of my trip was How purple/plum Pic du Gar looked from far away. The closer we got the more intense the color of the limestone became. Up close the limestone color played tricks on the eye. It wasn't until up close that you really got a sense of the color. 

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Silica, Iron Oxide

Color: Rapa Nui

Finish: Shimmer

Inspiration: Part of the 180 degrees south collection. This polish inspired by Rapa Nui's volcanic coast line. A blend of Blue and Dark Grey with specks of red volcanic rock.

name: Ridnitsohkka
description: *please note the green ombre bottom on these pictures. This is how the polish is intended to look, the more you mix, the more green glitters come into the polish. It creates a custom grey look* Color: Ridnitsohkka Description: Cool Grey with a hint green & shimmer. Finish: Creme with a hint of shimmer Inspiration: (Ridn for short) Ridnitsohkka is the 1st highest point fully inside Finland. Ridnitsohkka rises to an elevation of 4,321 ft. It's not the highest of mountains it is gorgeous non the less. It’s light grey isolated appearance was a beautiful color inspiration. You can see for miles. the nearest town is 50 km away. Batch Differences: Sept 2013 reformulation. No more ombre. straight light grey with the high shimmer green. Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Chromium Oxide, Iron Oxide Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. Finish: Creme (slight texture)

name: These boots were...
description:
Color: These boots were...

Description: These boots where… is a hard color to describe. It’s a red-ish purple with a slight shift to blue-ish with plenty of medium sized red-gold-pink flake shimmer.

Finish: Shimmer

Inspiration: Part of the tools of the trade collection. Inspiration...Yup, inspired by my boots. What else can I say besides a pair of really great hiking boots can make or break a good trip. These babies have seen some sights and helped me enjoy doing what I love… being out in nature.

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate
Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: Toubkal
description:
Color: Toubkal Description: Darkened Red Purple with Gold, Red, Pink large irregularly shaped shimmer. Finish: Jelly-Creme "Crelly" Hybrid/Shimmer Application Tip: Please allow drying time between layers. Without any drying time the shimmer might drag toward the tip of the nail causing streaking. Inspiration: Part of the Morocco Collection. Toubkal has one of the most amazing summits. The view from the top is nothing short of spectacular. You can see for miles and miles but I got fixated on the valleys below and how all that green short grasses mixed with shadowing looks like it was glowing and shining purple. Batch Differences: Dec's Batch is more pigmented than Nov's batch. Because of the extra pigment the shimmer is a tad less apparent. It is still a jelly-creme hybrid. June 2013 batch has a larger particle size of shimmer. Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Tin Oxide, Silica, Iron Oxide, D&C red 7 (CI 15850), Ultramarines Stainless Steel Nail polish grade mixing BBs Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames. Swatch Photos Courtesy of: XOXO Alexis Leigh
Ida Nails it
Spaz & Squee

name: Trift
description:
Swatch pictures taken over pico do fogo brown in direct outdoor sunlight. 

Color: Trift

Description: Simple single glitter topper. Iridescent hexes in a medium size shift in the light from sheer almost invisible to a vivid blue. In some lights it may look gold. 

Finish: Heavy glitter

Inspiration: Trift glacier is a small glacier around the area of Berne, Switzerland. This simple glitter was inspired by the look down and to the side from the trift bridge. the longest pedestrian only in the alps. The glacial waters shift from being sheer like regular water to an amazing blue glacier color. 

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, silica, alumina, Trimethylpentanediyl, dibenzoate, polyvinyl butyral, Polydimethylsiloxane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, glitter

name: INFO Nail Care
description:
INFO NAIL CARE

3 Amazing products coming soon. They are slated to be released June 2013.

name: Mountaineers Cuticle Balm
description:
BalmsNBaubles for Elevation Polish

Mountaineers Cuticle Balm. Cuticle Balm scented exclusively for elevation polish. This cuticle balm is lightly scented like fresh mountain air hitting the sea. Rich, Warm, sweet flowery vanilla. 

More details coming soon

name: Clean as snow Cuticle Balm
description:
BalmsNBaubles for Elevation Polish

Clean as snow Cuticle Balm. Cuticle Balm non-scented exclusively made for elevation polish. While being unscented it still has a faint smell of shea butter. 

This is a full sized product.

name: Clean as Snow Cuticle Oil
description:
BalmsNBaubles for Elevation Polish

Clean as snow cuticle oil. Cuticle oil is non-scented and made exclusively for elevation polish. 

This is a full sized product.

name: INFO Last Call & D/Ced
description:
INFO ABOUT LAST CALL & DISCONTINUED POLISHES


First come, first served on last call and discontinued polishes. 

Once they are gone they are gone and can not be recreated for custom listing. 

Some of these have been pulled from my personal batch archive. They may have been swatched on a nail wheel to test the batch over time.

name: Ubsunur
description:
Color: Ubsunur

Description: Blackened Blue with hints of blue mirco shimmer

Finish: Iridescent 

Inspiration: Ubsunur has a special place in my heart. A small portion of my friends ashes are scattered near ubsunur hollow in Mongolia on the boarder of Russia. She was an expert rock climber, mother of 6 beautiful children (my god kiddos), and a lover of all things blue including nail polish. This blackened blue with blue shimmer would have been a color she would have loved.

Batch Differences: None

Ingredients: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, Nitrocellulose, acetyl tributyl citrate, Adipic Acid/ neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, isopropal alcohol, stearalkonium bentonite, acrylates copolymer, styrene/acrylates copolymer, benzophenone-1, Magnesium Stearate, Mica (which may include) Titanium Dioxide, Tin Oxide, Silica, Iron Oxide
Stainless Steal Nail polish grade mixing BBs

Keep out of reach of small children. For external use only, do not consume. Keep away from open flames.

name: INFO Samples & Prototypes
description:
INFO ABOUT SAMPLES, PROTOTYPES & ONE OF A KIND(s)

One of a Kinds/Samples
They will be released in small amounts. In some cases I might have more than one of that color. They will have the same sample # on the bottom. These are first come, first served. I can not replicate any of these colors for custom orders. Ingredients may vary and sometimes I do use pre-existing nail polish colors to make these. Most of the time they will be 3 free and other times not. If you are sensitive to nail polishes that are not 3 free. Please do not buy these. To keep the cost and time of these low. There will not be swatches, ingredients won’t be listed and the descriptions will be brief.

Some of the reasons they didn’t make the cut.

The pigment is no longer available.
The pigment or glitter is just too expensive to be practical.
Pigment samples
Glitter samples
Sample combinations
The color was close but not exactly right.
The color didn’t fit into the collection.
Idea or Concept


How will they be priced? 
Some will have price tag of $7.00. The ones that were too expensive to be practical will have a price of $10.00. In some cases the bottle will be 80-90% full after testing the color out on nail wheels. Those will be noted and priced based on how much actual product is left in the bottle.

name: SBP: Frozen
description:
Name: Frozen (Small batch prototype) 

Description: Light blue jelly with an arrangement of periwinkle glitters and a touch of moss green micro glitter

Please limit your orders to 2 polishes total that are labeled SBP or Sample, monthly. This will allow others to also enjoy this limited release polish. This polish will not be available for custom creations.

name: INFO Small Batch Prototypes
description:
INFO ABOUT SMALL BATCH PROTOTYPES

What are small batch prototypes?

Small batch prototypes are polishes that I considered for the line up. The larger scale of these prototypes (28 bottles+) was to test to see how the ingredients would "upscale" from a single polish batch. 

These small batch prototypes are polishes that aren't going to be making the line up. 

I can not recreate these for custom listings.
